ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Korean vocabulary, grammar, speaking, listening, writing, reading
Better Korean grammar, vocabulary, speaking, reading, and writing!
This course built upon what was learned in KREN 110 and taught new vocabulary, expressions, and grammar points.
I learned L2 level skills of Korean writing, speaking, reading, and listening. This was all done by following every single page of the Sogang 1B Korean Textbook.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Great curriculum, opportunities for practice, small class, active teacher
Weaknesses: none

Strengths: very interactive, well organized, structured, assignments helped you practice what you learned in class

Weaknesses: workload felt overwhelming at times
Very engaging classes! Lots of time to practice and improve!

Strengths: very engaging and interactive, structured well as it follows the outline of the textbook, lots of opportunities to practice reading and speaking, quick turnaround and feedback on assignments

Weaknesses: nothing major

This class is very fast paced, which can make it difficult to keep up with the material. However, the class is very well organized and all of the class materials are posted on Canvas which is extremely helpful. Back is also very nice and a great instructor.

The strength of this course is that it went through everything planned in the syllabus and textbook. The weakness of this course taught by this particular professor is that everything went strictly according to the textbook and the class didn't have room for any other content whether fun or higher level grammar or vocabulary.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely, theres not much work but you learn so much. Its also so much fun to be in the classroom. It was often my favorite part of the day.
Yes! If you are interested in learning Korean, this is a great environment to do that.
Yes! Learning new languages is so important and Korean is a great language to learn! Keep practicing or you'll forget it all!

Yes, this course taught me a lot, as someone who had no Korean background. I think that Korean in general is taught very well at Yale, and the professors in this department are all super nice and helpful.
I would if you are interested in learning Korean and are fine with a high workload.

I would recommend this course because it's a simple and nice to learn Korean. However, in this particular section, you are getting three quizzes every week, an audio or video recording assignment for each lesson, and a workbook assignment with about 10 pages every lesson which I think may not be necessary and wasn't present in my previous Korean L1 section.
